cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n790.4" n="C" level="2"> For etiam nunc, <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still;</hi> to denote continuance (apparently not used by Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">stertis adhuc?</quote> <trans><tr>are you still snoring?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:58" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc tranquilla res est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is still quiet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ephesi regem est consecutus fluctuantem adhuc animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:49:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 49, 7</bibl></cit>; so 21, 43, 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 8, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 44, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Germ. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 18</bibl>: quinque satis fuerant; nam sex septemve libelli est nimium: quid adhuc ludere, Musa, juvat? <hi rend="ital">why play still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still more</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">further?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 3</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n790.5" n="D" level="2"> Hence also to denote that a thing is still remaining or existing: <cit><quote lang="la">at in veterum comicorum adhuc libris invenio,</quote> <trans><tr>I yet find in the old comic poets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe tres adhuc legiones erant,</quote> <trans><tr>were still left</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ann. 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:44:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 44, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">vb.</hi> omitted: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis adhuc precibus locus, exue mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 319</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n790.6" n="E" level="2"> To denote that a thing has only reached a certain point, <hi rend="ital">now first</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just now</hi>: cum adhuc (<hi rend="ital">now for the first time</hi>) naso odos obsecutus es meo, da vicissim meo gutturi gaudium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gangraenam vero, si nondum plane tenet, sed adhuc incipit, curare non difficillimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:102" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 102</bibl>.—Hence, with deinde or aliquando following: <cit><quote lang="la">quam concedis adhuc artem omnino non esse, sed aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:58:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 58, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus priusquam edicto convocaretur ad curiam concurrit, obseratisque adhuc foribus, deinde apertis, tantas mortuo gratias agit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 11</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n790.7" n="F" level="1"> To denote that a thing had reached a certain limit before another thing happened (in prose only after Livy), <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">while yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inconditam multitudinem adhuc disjecit,</quote> <trans><tr>he dispersed the multitude while yet unarranged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n790.8" n="G" level="1"> For <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insuper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praeterea</hi>, to denote that a thing occurs beside or along with another (belonging perhaps only to popular language, hence once in Plaut., and to the post-Aug. per.), <hi rend="ital">besides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">further</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moreover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">addam minam adhuc istic postea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unam rem adhuc adiciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt adhuc aliquae non omittendae in auro differentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 2, 10, § 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:34" default="NO">9, 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:429" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 429</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 16, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 11, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n790.9" n="H" level="1"> In later Lat. adhuc is used like <hi rend="ital">etiam</hi> in the Cic. per., = <foreign lang="greek">e)/ti</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">yet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, for the sake of emphasis in comparisons; then, if it cnhances the comparative, it stands before it; but follows it, if that which the comp. expresses is added by way of augmentation; as, <hi rend="ital">he has done a still greater thing</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">he has still done a greater thing</hi> (this is the view of Hand, Turs. I. p. 166): <cit><quote lang="la">tum Callicles adhuc concitatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc difficilior observatio est per tenores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si marmor illi (Phidiae), si adhuc viliorem materiem obtulisses, fecisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:34" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc diligentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 4</bibl></cit>: cui gloriae amplior<pb n="36" /> <cb n="ADIG" />  adhuc ex opportunitate cumulus accessit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Di faveant, majora adhuc restant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n790.10" n="I" level="1"> Adhuc sometimes = <hi rend="ital">adeo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">even</hi> (in the connection, et adhuc, -que adhuc; v. adeo, II.). </sense><sense id="n790.11" n="a" level="4"> Ita res successit meliusque adhuc, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tellurem Nymphasque et adhuc ignota precatur flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nil parvum sapias et adhuc sublimia cures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 2, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 49:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 49, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n790.12" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens non astuta nec callida aperit adhuc secreta pectoris licentiā joci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera similes Batavis, nisi quod ipso adhuc terrae suae solo et caelo acrius animantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 3</bibl></cit> (cf.: ipse adeo under adeo, II., and at the end); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:55" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 55</bibl>.—See more upon this word, Hand, Turs. I. pp. 156-167.</sense></entryFree>
adhucine: <entryFree id="n791" type="hapax" key="a^dhu_ci^ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădhūcĭne</orth> = adhuc ne, <sense id="n791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. interrog.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still? yet?</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 218</bibl>, where some read <hi rend="ital">adhucne.</hi></sense></entryFree>
adiabena: <entryFree id="n792" type="main" key="A^di^a^be_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ădĭăbēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ădĭăbēne</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*)adiabhnh/</foreign>, <sense id="n792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in the northern part of ancient Assyria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Botan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 20 al.</bibl>— Hence, </sense><sense id="n792.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n792.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ădĭăbēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining thereto</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Monobazus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2</bibl></cit>. —<orth extent="full" lang="la">Ădĭăbēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 9, 10, § 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n792.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ădĭăbēnĭcus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of the emperor Severus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as conqueror of Adiabene</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 9</bibl>; Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 903 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
adiantum: <entryFree id="n793" type="greek" key="a^di^antum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭantum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)di/anton</foreign>, <sense id="n793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant maiden-hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 30, § 62</bibl> (pure Lat.: capillus Veneris <hi rend="ital">or</hi> capillaris herba, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> H. 47</bibl>; Cael. Aurel. Tard. 3, 5).</sense></entryFree>
adiaphoros: <entryFree id="n794" type="greek" key="a^di^a^pho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭăphŏros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)dia/foros</foreign>, <sense id="n794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indifferent</hi>: nec dolere adiaphoron esse, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 82, 14</bibl> (better here written as Greek; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 16, 53</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
adiatorix: <entryFree id="n795" type="main" key="A^di^a^to^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ădĭătŏrix</orth>, <itype>ĭgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">king of the Comani</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken prisoner by Augustus at Actium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
adibilis: <entryFree id="n796" type="main" key="a^di^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭbĭlis</orth> <etym>1. adeo</etym>, <sense id="n796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">accessible</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 11, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adicio: <entryFree id="n797" type="main" key="a^di^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭcĭo</orth>, v. adjicio.</entryFree>
adigo: <entryFree id="n798" type="main" key="a^di^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-ĭgo</orth>, <itype>ēgi, actum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ago</etym> (adaxint = adegerint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 75, 5</bibl>; cf. adaxi for adegi), <sense id="n798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">take</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a place (syn.: appello, adduco, affero).—Constr. usu. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, but also with <case>acc.</case>, <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">local adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n798.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of cattle (cf. ago, I.: <cit><quote lang="la">abigo, abigeus, etc.): quis has huc ovīs adegit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactantes vitulos ad matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecore e longinquioribus vicis adacto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos per publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 19</bibl></cit>. —Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">mox noctu te adiget horsum insomnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fulmine ad umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis deus Italiam vos adegit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 601</bibl></cit>.—Hence: adigere aliquem arbitrum (ad arbitrum), <hi rend="ital">to compel one to come before an arbiter</hi> (like adigere (ad) jus jurandum; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">finibus regundis adigere arbitrum non possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 10, 43</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 9, 25</bibl>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">classem e Ponto Byzantium adigi jusserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteras navium per fossas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 18</bibl></cit>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum adiguntur naves, i. e. in mare impelluntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ann. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna fistucis,</quote> <trans><tr>to drive in by rammers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—Esp. often of weapons, <hi rend="ital">to drive home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plunge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to send to</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">ut felum adigi non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 23</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 431</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 271</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastae ardentes adactae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum jugulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per obscena ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum in viscera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:626" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 626</bibl></cit>.— And from the weapons transf. to the wound, <hi rend="ital">to inflict</hi> (in the poets and Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">alte vulnus adactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 850</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi vulnus Varo adactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus per galeam adegit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n798.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig. </sense><sense id="n798.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urge</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring one to</hi> a situation, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> a state of mind, or <hi rend="ital">to</hi> an act (esp. against his will): <cit><quote lang="la">tu, homo, adigis me ad insaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adigit ita Postumia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acri cupidine adigi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 22</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with the <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> without ut: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vis vim mihi afferam ipsa adigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—With the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: vertere morsus exiguam in Cererem penuria adegit <cb n="ADIM" /> edendi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 114</bibl>; cf. 6, 696; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:472" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 472</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:531" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 531</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">So also: tres liburnicas adactis per vim gubernatoribus ascendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 28</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n798.4" n="B" level="2"> Adigere aliquem ad jus jurandum, jus jurandum, or jure jurando, or sacramento (<case>abl.</case>), t. t., <hi rend="ital">to put one on oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause one to take oath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to swear one</hi> (from the time of Livy oftener with <case>abl.</case>; so Tac.. Just., Flor.; cf. on this point Cortius ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22</bibl>; Held ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl>; Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 67</bibl>; Rudd. II. p. 328, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 16): <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus jus jurandum adactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad jus jurandum populares sceleris sui adigeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam omnem in sua et Pompeii verba jus jurandum adigebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores ita jus jurandum adigebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:18" default="NO">7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum jure jurando adegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus junioribus jure jurando adactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 33</bibl></cit>; so 6, 38; 7, 9, 11 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:11" default="NO">8, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl>.—Hence ellipt.: in verba adigere, for <hi rend="ital">in verba jus jurandum adigere</hi> in Tac. and Suet. (cf. the passage cited above, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 18</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">neque se neque quemquam Batavum in verba Galliarum adegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia Narbon. in verba Vitellii adacta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; so 4, 59; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>.— And finally quite <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: adigere (sc. jure jurando, sacramento), <hi rend="ital">to bind by an oath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno cum assensu auditus ... universos adigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n798.5" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> = subigere, <hi rend="ital">to subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bisque jugo Rhenum, bis adactum legibus Istrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in faciem prorae pinus adacta novae,</quote> <trans><tr>brought into the form of a ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:22:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 22, 14</bibl></cit>.!*? In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 1</bibl>: mare quod adigit ad ostium Rhodani, we have a false reading, for which Nipperdey restored <hi rend="ital">adjacet.</hi></sense></entryFree>
adimo: <entryFree id="n799" type="main" key="a^di^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-ĭmo</orth>, <itype>ēmi, emptum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>emo</etym> (adempsit = ademerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 27</bibl>), <sense id="n799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take to</hi> one's self from a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take any thing from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of</hi> (syn.: demere, eximere, auterre, eripere). </sense><sense id="n799.1" n="I" level="1"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">si ego memorem quae me erga fecisti bene, nox diem adimat,</quote> <trans><tr>would take away</tr>, <tr>consume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: multa ferunt anni venientes commoda secum; multa recedentes adimunt, <hi rend="ital">take them away with themselves</hi>, as a fine antithesis to <hi rend="ital">secum ferunt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut istas compedes tibi adimam, huic dem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter, ingentes qui das adimisque dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam adempta spes est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum litoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires ad vincendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pernicitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl></cit>.—And <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Qui propter invidiam adimunt diviti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">adimam cantare severis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit> (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)fairh/somai a)ei/dein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">I will prohibit them to sing;</hi> so <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 7, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:425" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 425</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n799.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of persons, <hi rend="ital">to snatch away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to carry off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc, nisi mors, mihi adimet nemo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo, quae puellas audis adimisque leto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—(For the distinction between demere, adimere, eximere, v. Lamb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31</bibl>; Bentl. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 18</bibl>; and cf. Doed. Syn. IV. pp. 123-126.)</sense></entryFree>
adimpleo: <entryFree id="n800" type="main" key="a^dimple^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-implĕo</orth>, <itype>ēvi, ētum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fill up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fill full</hi> (in the class. per., e. g. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7, 13</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 52, § 140</bibl>, dub.). </sense><sense id="n800.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gangem decem fluminibus adimpleri, Aethic. Cosmogr. p. 709 ed. Gron.: quasi mare adimpleti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 50, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n800.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adimpleti tibiarum cantu vocant deam suam, Jul. Firm. de Err. p. 10 (cf. adimpletor): adimplebis me laetitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 15, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n800.3" n="II" level="1"> Metaph., <hi rend="ital">to fulfil</hi> (as a promise, prediction, duty), <hi rend="ital">to perform</hi>, = absolvere, satisfacere, praestare: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dictum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut adimpleatur scriptura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Joan. 13, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem Christi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Gal. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gratia vobis et pax adimpleatur,</quote> <trans><tr>be made full</tr>, <tr>perfect</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 2.</sense></entryFree>
adimpletio: <entryFree id="n801" type="main" key="a^dimple_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădimplētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>adimpleo</etym>. <sense id="n801.0" n="I" level="1"> <cb n="ADIP" /> <hi rend="ital">A completing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n801.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fulfilling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fulfilment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum (testamentum) veteris adimpletio est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adimpletor: <entryFree id="n802" type="hapax" key="a^dimple_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădimplētor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>adimpleo</etym>, <sense id="n802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who fills</hi> (by inspiration), <hi rend="ital">the inspirer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Filius Dei adimpletor prophetarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Temp. Serm. 144:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Temp. Serm. 144, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adincresco: <entryFree id="n803" type="main" key="a^dincresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-incresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 23, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
adindo: <entryFree id="n804" type="hapax" key="a^dindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-indo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put in besides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subscudes iligneas adindito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adinflo: <entryFree id="n805" type="main" key="a^dinflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-inflo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swell up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> C. D. 19, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adingero: <entryFree id="n806" type="hapax" key="a^dinge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-ingĕro</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring to in addition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to heap on</hi>: satiram in aliquem, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
adinquiro: <entryFree id="n807" type="hapax" key="a^dinqui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-inquīro</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to investigate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inquire into further</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:1:49" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> 1, 49</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
adinstar: <entryFree id="n808" type="main" key="a^dinstar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădinstar</orth>, <itype>more properly ad instar</itype>, v. instar.</entryFree>
adinvenio: <entryFree id="n809" type="main" key="a^dinve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-invĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ad, <hi rend="ital">intens.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to find out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to devise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 28</bibl>; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 603</bibl>: lapicaedinae adinventae sunt, Labi Ins.: si quis ainventus (for <hi rend="ital">adinventus</hi>) fuerit hoc fecisse, Mur. Ins. 794.</sense></entryFree>
adinventio: <entryFree id="n810" type="main" key="a^dinventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădinventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>adinvenio</etym>, <sense id="n810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invention</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 2, 19</bibl>; Isa. 3, 8 al.</sense></entryFree>
adinventor: <entryFree id="n811" type="main" key="a^dinventor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădinventor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inventor;</hi> transl. of <foreign lang="greek">e)feureth/s</foreign>, Cyprian. Ep. 68, 10.</sense></entryFree>
adinventum: <entryFree id="n812" type="main" key="a^dinventum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădinventum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an invention</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
adinvicem: <entryFree id="n813" type="main" key="a^dinvi^cem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-invĭcem</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, a strengthened form of invicem (q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Trin. 7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Trin. 7</bibl>.</entryFree>
adinvolvo: <entryFree id="n814" type="main" key="a^dinvolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-involvo</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, read by Alschefski in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl>, manu ad digitos usque adinvolutā, but Weissenb. still reads <sense id="n814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">involutā.</hi></sense></entryFree>
adipalis: <entryFree id="n815" type="hapax" key="a^di^pa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭpālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>adeps</etym>, <sense id="n815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">with fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greasy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 115</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adipatum: <entryFree id="n816" type="main" key="a^di^pa_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭpātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, see the foll. art.</entryFree>
adipatus: <entryFree id="n817" type="main" key="a^di^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>adeps</etym>, <sense id="n817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">supplied with fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greasy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n817.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: puls, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 73</bibl> and 74 P.; hence, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭpātum</orth> (sc. edulium), i, <hi rend="ital">pastry prepared with fat</hi> (cf. Charis. l. c.): <cit><quote lang="la">livida materno fervent adipata veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:630" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 630</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n817.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of discourse, <hi rend="ital">coarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gross</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opimum quoddam et tamquam adipatae orationis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 8, 25</bibl></cit>; also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 69, 6</bibl> (al. adipale).</sense></entryFree>
adipeus: <entryFree id="n818" type="main" key="a^di^pe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭpĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of fat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 147, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adipiscor: <entryFree id="n819" type="main" key="a^di^piscor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ăd-ĭpiscor</orth>, <itype>eptus, 3</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>apiscor</etym>, <sense id="n819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to arrive at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reach.</hi> </sense><sense id="n819.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: occepi sequi; <cit><quote lang="la">vix adipiscendi potestas fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence also with <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to overtake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientes Gallos Macedones adepti ceciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30, 14</bibl>.—Far oftener, </sense><sense id="n819.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">to attain to by effort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to get possession of</hi> (by overcoming natural obstacles; diff. from <hi rend="ital">impetrare</hi>, to reach or obtain by victory over another's will; and <hi rend="ital">nancisci</hi>, by accident, Doed. Syn. III. pp. 145, 146; <cit><quote lang="la">IV. p. 369): nuptias effugere ego istas malo quam tu adipiscier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: senectutem ut adipiscantur, omnes optant; <cit><quote lang="la">eandem accusant adepti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summos honores a populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimos dignitatis gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,034:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccli. 44, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">46, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta instrumenta (homo) habeat ad obtinendam adipiscendamque sapientiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 59 al.</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Chabr. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:116" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 6, 15</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeptum esse omnia e natura et animo et corpore et vitā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 59</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut.</hi> adepti sunt, ut dies festos agitare possent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 21</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potestis adipisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,020:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jac. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.!*? </sense><sense id="n819.3" n="a" level="4"> iis adipiscendi magistratus, <hi rend="ital">they should strive for public honors</hi> (the <hi rend="ital">consequens</hi> for the <hi rend="ital">antecedens</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 72</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n819.4" n="b" level="4"> Nero in adipiscenda morte (Epaphroditi) manu adjutus existimabatur, i. e. consciscenda, <hi rend="ital">in committing suicide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl> Oud.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:92" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:4:4:15" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 4, 4, 15</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">invenire mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 645</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n819.5" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aetate, verum ingenio, adipiscitur sapientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: haec <pb n="37" /> <cb n="ADJA" /> adipiscuntur, C. Fannius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.: amitti magis quam adipisci, Fab. Maximus, ib.; <cit><quote lang="la">so esp. adeptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 790 sq.</bibl>; Rudd. I. p. 288; Kritz ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n819.6" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma, quīs Galba rerum adeptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 45</bibl> (here Halm reads <hi rend="ital">apisceretur</hi>); Rudd. II. p. 120; Zumpt, § 466.</sense></entryFree>
adipsatheon: <entryFree id="n820" type="main" key="a^dipsathe^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădipsathĕon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">a)/diyos - qeo/s</foreign>, quenching the thirst of the gods</etym>, <sense id="n820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny shrub</hi>, also called <hi rend="ital">erysisceptrum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diacheton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 69, § 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
adipsos: <entryFree id="n821" type="greek" key="a^dipsos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădipsos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)/diyos</foreign> (quenching thirst). <sense id="n821.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A species of date</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 22, 47, § 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n821.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Liquorice</hi>, glycyrrhiza, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 9, 11, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
aditialis: <entryFree id="n822" type="main" key="a^di^ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭtĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aditus</etym>, <sense id="n822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to entrance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <trans><tr>given by a magistrate when he entered upon his office</tr>, <tr>an inaugural feast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:41" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:123:4" default="NO">123, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 20, 23, § 45</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">epulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 14, § 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
aditiculus: <entryFree id="n823" type="main" key="a^di^ti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭtĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, “parvus aditus,” <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=29" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 29</bibl> Müll.—The same in the <sense id="n823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭtĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:3:70" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> 3, 70</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
aditio: <entryFree id="n824" type="main" key="a^di^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. adeo</etym>. <sense id="n824.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi>: quid tibi hanc aditio est? (i. e. aditio ad hanc, the verbal substantive with the case of the verb; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Zumpt, § 681),</quote> <trans><tr>why do you approach her?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:1 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 1, 1 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n824.1" n="II" level="1"> hereditatis, <hi rend="ital">the entering upon an inheritance</hi> (v. 1. adeo, II. A.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:77 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 77 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
adito: <entryFree id="n825" type="main" key="a^di^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi</itype>, <sense id="n825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to go to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">approach often</hi>: ad eum aditavere, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 336</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 433 ed. Vahl.); perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl>: aditet aviarius qui, etc. (instead of <hi rend="ital">habitet</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">si adites propius, os denasabit tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 75</bibl></cit>; where Ritschl reads <hi rend="ital">adbites.</hi></sense></entryFree>
aditus: <entryFree id="n826" type="main" key="a^di^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 1. adeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n827" type="main" key="a^di^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ădĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. adeo</etym>, <sense id="n827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">access.</hi> </sense><sense id="n827.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum abitu aut aditu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes permultas uno aditu atque adventu esse captas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo neque sit ventis aditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:293:423 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 293, 423 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus ad eum difficilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:173" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (cf. 1. adeo): <cit><quote lang="la">aditus in id sacrarium non est viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45</bibl></cit>; so Auct. Or. pro Dom. 42, 110 al.: aditus ad me minime provinciales, <hi rend="ital">which are not made in the manner customary</hi> (<hi rend="ital">with the prœtor</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n827.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n827.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The possibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permission</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">right of approaching</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">of admittance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">access</hi> (cf. accessus): <cit><quote lang="la">faciles aditus ad eum privatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo rari aditūs,</quote> <trans><tr>a man rarely accessible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui mihi erit aditus de tuis fortunis agendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n827.4" n="B" level="2"> Coner., <hi rend="ital">the place through which one approaches</hi> a thing, <hi rend="ital">an entrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avenue</hi>, etc. (opp. abitus; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also accessus): primo aditu vestibuloque prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus insulae muniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 226</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 157</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 44</bibl>.—Hence trop. (in Cic. very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">quartus aditus ad initia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 8</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus ad causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibula honesta aditusque ad causam illustres facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:25:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 25, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 17 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
adjacentia: <entryFree id="n828" type="main" key="adja^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjăcentĭa</orth>, <sense id="n828.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
adjaceo: <entryFree id="n829" type="main" key="adja^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-jăcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi</itype>, no <sense id="n829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to lie at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be contiguous to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to border upon</hi> (most freq. used of the geog. position of a place).—Constr. with <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (in the histt. very freq.).—</sense><sense id="n829.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tuscus ager Romano adjacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 49, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 42, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 21, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Romani adjacerent vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjacet undis moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae adjacent torrenti Jeboc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 2, 37</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velle adjacet mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n829.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes, quae mare illud adjacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Tim. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Tim. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etruriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 6</bibl></cit> (v. <cb n="ADJI" /> Alschefski and Weissenb. ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n829.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Syrtim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; so perh. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 33, 2</bibl>: quae (regio) ad Aduatucos adjacet (for the lect. vulg. <hi rend="ital">Aduatucos</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Aduatucis</hi>), and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 1</bibl>; v. adigo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n829.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjacet (via) et mollior et magis trita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjacente Tiberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 93</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adjacentes populi, i. q. propinqui,</quote> <trans><tr>contiguous</tr>, <tr>neighboring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 55</bibl></cit>.—And <orth extent="full" lang="la">adjăcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the adjoining country</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacum in adjacentia erupturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">projecto nitore adjacentia inlustrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adjaculatus: <entryFree id="n830" type="hapax" key="adja^cu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-jăcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thrown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, p. 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adjecticius: <entryFree id="n831" type="main" key="adjecti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjectīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>adjicio</etym>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">added besides</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">incommoda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 11, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adjectio: <entryFree id="n832" type="main" key="adjecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adding to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">addition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annexation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n832.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romana res adjectione populi Albani aucta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illiberalis,</quote> <trans><tr>a small addition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 189" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">the permission of adding</hi>, etc. (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">accessus, aditus): Hispalensibus familiarum adjectiones dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>he granted to them the right of settling new families</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> II. 1, 78</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n832.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., as t. t. </sense><sense id="n832.3" n="A" level="2"> In archit. </sense><sense id="n832.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A projection in the pedestal of columns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the cornice of the pedestal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n832.5" n="B" level="2"> In medicine, <hi rend="ital">a strengthening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invigorating remedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (i. e. diseases) non detractionibus, sed adjectionibus curantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n832.6" n="C" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">the repetition of the same word</hi>, e. g. occidi, occidi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 28</bibl> (in Cic., adjunctio, q. v.).—</sense><sense id="n832.7" n="D" level="2"> In auctions, <hi rend="ital">the addition to a bid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:17 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 2, 17 al.</bibl>; cf. adjicio.</sense></entryFree>
adjectivus: <entryFree id="n833" type="main" key="adjecti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjectīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, in gram., <sense id="n833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is added</hi> to the noun substantive, <hi rend="ital">adjective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et significat vel laudem vel vituperationem, vel medium vel accidens, ut justus, impius, magnus, albus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 578</bibl></cit> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
adjecto: <entryFree id="n834" type="spur" key="adjecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjecto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 2</bibl>.</entryFree>
adjectus: <entryFree id="n835" type="main" key="adjectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, of adjicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n836" type="main" key="adjectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>adjicio</etym>, <sense id="n836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">applying to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odoris (ad narīs),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 673</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 689</bibl>: cuneorum, <hi rend="ital">addition</hi> (opp. exemptus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
adjicio: <entryFree id="n837" type="main" key="adji^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-jĭcĭo</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">adicio</orth>), <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>jacio</etym>, <sense id="n837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">place at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near.</hi>—Constr.: aliquid alicui rei. </sense><sense id="n837.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rogum bustumve novum vetat propius sexaginta pedes adici aedes alienas,</quote> <trans><tr>to place nearer than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordei numero ad summam tritici adjecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 3, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjectoque cavae supplentur sanguine venae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 291</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 266</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 276</bibl>.— More freq. trop.: quo ne imprudentiam quidem oculorum adici fas fuit, <hi rend="ital">to turn the eyes pryingly to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to direct the sight to</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 14, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthus adjecit Armeniae manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:100" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">album calculum errori,</quote> <trans><tr>to approve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus in anguīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum ex locis superioribus in litus,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw</tr>, <tr>to hurl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n837.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to mental objects, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">direct the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eye</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fasten them upon</hi> something.—With <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui amabilitati animum adiceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum militi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad virginem animum adjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad omnia vestra pauci homines cupiditatis oculos adjecissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plane videbant adjectum esse oculum hereditati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:15:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 15, § 37</bibl></cit> (diff. from adicere oculos, cited above): <cit><quote lang="la">adjecit animum ad consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novo etiam consilio animum adjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n837.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n837.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To add</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apply to</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">by way of increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">prostiqe/nai</foreign> (cf. addo).—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg> and trop.; constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bellicam laudem ingenii gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:36" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquantum ea res duci famae et auctoritatis adjecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33</bibl></cit>: so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:38 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 38 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">morem ritusque sacrorum adiciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 837</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjecere bonae paulo plus artis Athenac,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 656</bibl>; id. P. l, 8, 56; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 6, 27</bibl> <cb n="ADJU" /> and 33; also <hi rend="ital">to add a new thought to</hi> what has preceded (cf.: addo, accedo, advenio; hence, like addo, in the <number>sing.</number>, though several persons are addressed): <cit><quote lang="la">huc natas adice septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n837.5" n="B" level="2"> Of a speaker, <hi rend="ital">to add to</hi> what has already been said. —Constr. with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (only in Vell. and in the histt. after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">adiciens numquam defuturos raprores Italicae libertatis lupos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:27:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 27, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adjecerat Tiberius non id tempus censurae nec defuturum corrigendi auctorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjecit in domo ejus venenum esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 21</bibl></cit>.—Rarely followed by orat. directa: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dixisset ... adjecissetque: Si quid huic acciderit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n837.6" n="C" level="2"> In anctions, t. t., <hi rend="ital">to add to a bid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to out-bid</hi>: liciti sunt usque adeo, quoad se efficere posse arbitrabantur; <cit><quote lang="la">super adjecit Aeschrio,</quote> <trans><tr>bid on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33, § 77</bibl></cit> B. and K.; but cf. Zumpt ad h. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 2, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n837.7" n="D" level="2"> In gen., in the Vulg. by Hebraism (cf. <foreign />), <hi rend="ital">to add to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do further</hi>: adjecit Dominus loqui, <hi rend="ital">the Lord furthermore spake</hi>, Isa. 7, 10: <cit><quote lang="la">non adiciet, ut resurgat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:20" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 24, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adiciens dixit parabolam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Luc. 19:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Luc. 19, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adjubeo: <entryFree id="n838" type="spur" key="adju^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-jŭbĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 50</bibl>, instead of <sense id="n838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ut jubeat</hi> (Ritschl); and in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 32, 4</bibl>, inst. of <hi rend="ital">adjuvato.</hi></sense></entryFree>
adjudicatio: <entryFree id="n839" type="main" key="adju_di^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūdĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>adjudico</etym>, <sense id="n839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a judicial adjudging of a matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an adjudication</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:78 al" default="NO">28, 5, 78 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
adjudico: <entryFree id="n840" type="main" key="adju_di^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-jūdĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">award</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">as judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to adjudge</hi> (opp. abjudico).—With <case>acc.</case> and <case>dat.</case> </sense><sense id="n840.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: me est aequum frui fraternis armis mihique adjudicarier, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
