Her.</author> 2, 26, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum Ptolemaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem Veneri in servitutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bruto legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo dubitabat, quin domus nobis esset adjudicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 42</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hipp. 109" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hipp. 109</bibl>.—And <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of Augustus: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid abest (i. e. dicioni Romanorum nondum subjectum) Italis adjudicat armis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>like a judge</tr>, <tr>he subjects the nations to the Roman sway</tr>, <tr>merely by his arbitrary sentence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to decide in one's favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:29:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 29, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n840.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ascribe</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">to</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius saepe hujus mihi salutem imperii adjudicavit,</quote> <trans><tr>has ascribed to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum saporem ostreis Lucrinis adjudicavit,</quote> <trans><tr>conceded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl></cit>.!*? For adjudicato in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 6</bibl>, Ritschl reads <hi rend="ital">tu judicato.</hi></sense></entryFree>
adjuero: <entryFree id="n841" type="main" key="adjuero"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjuero</orth> = adjuvero, v. adjuvo.</entryFree>
adjugo: <entryFree id="n842" type="main" key="adju^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-jŭgo</orth>, no <sense id="n842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to yoke</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n842.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, in the lang. of gardening: <cit><quote lang="la">palmites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pampinos adjugatae (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 175</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n842.2" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">add to</hi> something: mater est terra, ea parit corpus, animam aether adjugat, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 75, 11</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 88</bibl>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">blandam hortatricem adjugat Voluptatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 75, 13</bibl></cit> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 100</bibl>): adjugat corpora, of the sexes, Lact. Opif. Dei, 6.</sense></entryFree>
adjumentum: <entryFree id="n843" type="main" key="adju_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>a contraction of adjuvamentum, from adjuvo</etym>, <sense id="n843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of aid; help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aderat (in illa puella) adjumenti ad pulchritudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse alicui magno adjumento ad victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quam ad rem magnum attulimus adjumentum hominibus nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjumenta et subsidia consulatūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjumenta salutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis aliis adjumentis petitionis ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 2</bibl>; Quint. prooem. § 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:31 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 31 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
adjunctio: <entryFree id="n844" type="main" key="adjuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>adjungo</etym>, <sense id="n844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">binding to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a union</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conjunction</hi> (Cicero; esp. in his rhet. writings). </sense><sense id="n844.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: si haec (sc. <foreign lang="greek">fusikh\ h( pro\s ta\ te/kna</foreign>) non est, nulla potest homini esse ad hominem naturae adjunctio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 6:21" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 6, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n844.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n844.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An addition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13</bibl></cit>, <pb n="38" /> <cb n="ADJU" /> 39: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n844.4" n="B" level="2"> In rhet. </sense><sense id="n844.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A limitation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">restriction made by an addition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a limiting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">restricting adjunct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse quasdam cum adjunctione necessitudines ... illic, in superiore, adjunctio (i. e. exceptio) est haec: nisi malint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:57:171" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 57, 171</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n844.6" n="2" level="3"> A figure of speech, acc. to Forcell. = <foreign lang="greek">sumplokh/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">repetition of the same word</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl> (as an example, v. Agr. 2, 9: Quis legem tulit? Rullus. Quis majorem partem populi suffragiis prohibuit? Rullus.); acc. to Auct. Her., we have an <hi rend="ital">adjunctio</hi> when the verb stands either at the beginning or at the end of a clause, as opp. to <hi rend="ital">conjunctio</hi>, i. e. when the verb is interposed amid the words, 4, 27, 38; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 33</bibl>, and 9, 3, 62.</sense></entryFree>
adjunctivus: <entryFree id="n845" type="main" key="adjuncti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjunctīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>adjungo</etym>, <sense id="n845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is joined</hi> or <hi rend="ital">added.</hi>—In gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctiones,</quote> <trans><tr>conjunctions that govern the subj. mood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1028</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">modus,</quote> <trans><tr>the subjunctive mood</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 331</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
adjunctor: <entryFree id="n846" type="hapax" key="adjunctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjunctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who adds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joins</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">unites</hi> (used only by Cic. in strong indignation): <cit><quote lang="la">ille Galliae ulterioris adjunctor, i. e. Pompey, by whose influence Gallia Transalpina was granted to Cæsar, in addition to Gallia Cisalpina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adjungo: <entryFree id="n847" type="main" key="adjungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-jungo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annex</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bind to</hi> any thing. </sense><sense id="n847.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of cattle, <hi rend="ital">to yoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to harness</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jugo, jugum, jungo, etc.): adjunxere feras (preceded by bijugos agitare leones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plostello mures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigribus adjunctis aurea lora dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 552</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n847.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n847.3" n="A" level="2"> Of persons or things, <hi rend="ital">to join</hi> or <hi rend="ital">add to.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad probos te adjunxeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">where the figure of yoking is closely adhered to (v. the connection): adjunge te ad currum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socium quaerit, quem adjungat sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitem T. Volturcium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se comitem fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei proxime adjunctus frater fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viro se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuncti sunt Paulo et Silae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessionem aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulmis vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem lateri castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 69</bibl></cit>; so esp. freq. of places, <hi rend="ital">lying near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjacent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic fundo continentia quaedam praedia et adjuncta mercatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caec. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:642" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 642</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ad malam aetatem adjungere cruciatum, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium credat gravius esse, vi quod fit, quam illud quod amicitia adjungitur,</quote> <trans><tr>the command which is put upon him</tr>, <tr>given him</tr>, <tr>with kind feeling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>.—Hence, adjungere aliquem sibi, <hi rend="ital">to bind to</hi> one's self, <hi rend="ital">to enter into friendship with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make one a friend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam colere, adjuvare, adjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 19</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. 7" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alc. 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">agros populo Romano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam ad imperium pop. R. Ciliciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem in societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 15</bibl></cit>: sibi aliquem beneficio, <hi rend="ital">to lay one under obligation to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to oblige</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem beneficio adjungas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also without beneficio: ut parentes propinquosque eorum adjungeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n847.4" n="B" level="2"> Met. of mental objects, <hi rend="ital">to apply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to direct to</hi> (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad aliquod studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem visis,</quote> <trans><tr>to give credit to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc animum ut adjungas tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentia vestra nobis adjungenda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliquis metus adjunctus sit ad gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem potius ad praedam quam ad egestatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to direct suspicion rather to him who possesses the booty</tr>, <tr>than to him who lives in poverty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n847.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To add</hi> or <hi rend="ital">join something to</hi> a thing as an accompaniment, <hi rend="ital">to annex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to subjoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to let follow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>: audi atque auditis hostimentum adjungito, <hi rend="ital">hear and let requital follow what is heard</hi>, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. redhostire, p. 270 Müll. (Trag. v. 154 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">huic voluptati hoc adjunctum est odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam juris scientiam eloquentiae tamquam ancillulam pedisequamque adjunxisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 236</bibl></cit>.— Hence of a new thought or circumstance, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="ADJU" /> <hi rend="ital">add it to the preceding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum dicerem, illud adjunxi: mihi tecum ita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis erit dictum, si hoc unum adjunxero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">His adjungit, Hylan nautae quo fonte relictum Clamassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 43</bibl></cit> (v. addo, adjicio, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad ceteras summas utilitates, haec quoque opportunitas adjungatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 17, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Adjuncto vero, ut iidem etiam prudentes haberentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n847.6" n="D" level="2"> In rhet.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">adjuncta</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">collateral circumstances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci argumentorum ex adjunctis repeti possunt, ut quaeratur, quid ante rem, quid cum re, quid postea evenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 12</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18</bibl>; cf. consequens.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">adjunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n847.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Joined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">added to</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">connected with a thing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae propiora hujus causae et adjunctiora sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventum ad veram et adjunctissimam quaestionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 243</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n847.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">adjuncta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">additional circumstances</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjuncts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">things closely connected with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belonging</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suitable to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper in adjunctis aevoque morabimur aptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 178</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> not used.</sense></entryFree>
adjuramentum: <entryFree id="n848" type="main" key="adju_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>adjuro</etym>, <sense id="n848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conjuring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreating</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tob. 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
adjuratio: <entryFree id="n849" type="main" key="adju_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swearing to</hi> something by something, <hi rend="ital">swearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjuration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuratione suae salutis,</quote> <trans><tr>by swearing by her own safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 123 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divini nominis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adjurator: <entryFree id="n850" type="main" key="adju_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who conjures a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a conjurer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 312</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
adjuratorius: <entryFree id="n851" type="main" key="adju_ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>adjurator</etym>, <sense id="n851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to swearing</hi>: cautio, Cod. 12, 26, 4, § 2; 12, 30, 3, § 3.</sense></entryFree>
adjuro: <entryFree id="n852" type="main" key="adju_ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-jūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swear to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confirm by an oath.</hi>—With <case>acc.</case>, or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n852.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam suam esse filiam sancte adjurabat mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjurasque id te me invito non esse facturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:129" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 2</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n852.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n852.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To swear</hi> by any person or thing: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes deos adjuro, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes tibi adjuro deos numquam eam me deserturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4</bibl>.—In the poetry of the Aug. per. after the manner of the Greek, with the <case>acc.</case> of that by which one swears (cf. <foreign lang="greek">o)/mnumi tou\s qeou/s</foreign>, in L. and S.): <cit><quote lang="la">adjuro Stygii caput implacabile fontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:816" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 816</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuro teque tuomque caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n852.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To swear to something in addition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores edixerunt, ut praeter commune jus jurandum haec adjurarent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n852.5" n="C" level="2"> In later Lat., <hi rend="ital">to conjure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adjure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to beg</hi> or <hi rend="ital">entreat earnestly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuratum esse in senatu Tacitum, ut optimum aliquem principem faceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Flor. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n852.6" n="D" level="2"> In the Church Fathers, <hi rend="ital">to adjure</hi> (in exorcising): <cit><quote lang="la">daemones Dei nomine adjurati de corporibus excedunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n853" type="main" key="adju_ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūro</orth>, i. q. adjuvero, v. adjuvo.</entryFree>
adjutabilis: <entryFree id="n854" type="hapax" key="adju_ta_bi^li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūtābĭlĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>adjuto</etym>, <sense id="n854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">helping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suited to aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serviceable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adjuto: <entryFree id="n855" type="main" key="adju_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [adjuvo] (ante-class.; esp. in Plaut. and Terence, and in later Lat.), <hi rend="ital">to help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be serviceable to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assist</hi>: aliquem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 424, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istocine pacto me adjutas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pamphilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. prol. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. prol. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 49</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id adjuta me, quo id fiat facilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: adjuta mihi, Pac. ap. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. prol. 16</bibl>; cf. Ruhnk. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 24</bibl>.—Also on a coin: <cit><quote lang="la">deus adjuta Romanis, Eckh. D. N. 8, p. 223: saltem nobis adjutāsses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. Trag. 62</bibl></cit> Burm.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutamur enim atque alimur certis ab rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:812" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 812</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adjutor: <entryFree id="n856" type="main" key="adju_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, i. q. adjuto, and also ante-class. (found in Pac., Afran., and Lucil.): adjutamini et defendite, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 74, 2</bibl>; R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 89</bibl>; Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 477, 26</bibl>: me adjutamini, Afran. ib.: magna adjutatus diu, Lucil. ib. <cb n="ADJU" /></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n857" type="main" key="adju_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>adjuvo</etym>, <sense id="n857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who helps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a helper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoter</hi> (class. through all periods). </sense><sense id="n857.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic adjutor meus et monitor et praemonstrator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus iracundiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hanc rem adjutorem dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutores ad me restituendum multi fuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in psaltria hac emunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad praedam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rose. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi venit adjutor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. ille Torquatus auctor exstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite dubitare libertatem consule adjutore defendere,</quote> <trans><tr>with the aid of the consul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:Agr. 16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. Agr. 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so often,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n857.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., a common name of a military or civil officer, <hi rend="ital">an aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjutant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deputy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretary</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">comites et adjutores negotiorum publicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dato adjutore Pharnabazo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Chabr. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorum (i. e. hypodidascali),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 9</bibl>; and in the inscriptions in Orell. 3462, 3200 al.; under the emperors <hi rend="ital">an officer of court</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minister</hi> (v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:127" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 127</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl>); usu. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and the word indicative of the office (v. ab <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">adjutor a rationibus, Orell. Inscr. 32: a sacris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a commentariis ornamentorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2892</bibl></cit>.— Also with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutor cornicularii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haruspicum imperatoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3420 al.</bibl></cit> —In scenic language, adjutor is the one who, by his part, sustains or assists the hero of the piece (<foreign lang="greek">prwtagwnisth/s</foreign>), to which the class. passage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15</bibl>, refers; cf. Heind. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scena postquam solus constitit sine apparatu, nullis adjutoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>with no subordinate actors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 4.</sense></entryFree>
adjutorium: <entryFree id="n858" type="main" key="adju_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>adjutor</etym>, <sense id="n858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">prob. not before the Aug. per.): magnam Thracum manum in adjutorium belli secum trahebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 83</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
adjutrix: <entryFree id="n859" type="main" key="adju_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that helps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an assistant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helper</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n859.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua fortuna fuerit adjutrix tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. prol. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres filiis in peccato adjutrices solent esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 46</bibl>: id. Hec. prol. alt. 24, 40; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 4, 83: Messana tuorum adjutrix scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:8:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 8, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva adjutrix consiliorum meorum, Auct. Or. pro Dom. 57: quae res Plancio in petitione fuisset adjutrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assentatio vitiorum adjutrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc urbem habebat adjutricem scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62, § 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n859.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones adjutrices,</quote> <trans><tr>legions raised by the proconsul in the provinces for the purpose of strengthening the veteran army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 44</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 10</bibl>; cf. Gruter, Ins. 193, 3; 414, 8; 169, 7 al.</sense></entryFree>
adjutus: <entryFree id="n860" type="main" key="adju_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of adjuvo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n861" type="hapax" key="adju_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adjūtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>adjuvo</etym>, <sense id="n861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius adjutu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adjuvo: <entryFree id="n862" type="main" key="adju^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-jŭvo</orth>, <itype>jūvi, jūtum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (very rare juvavi, juvatum; <sense id="n862.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">hence, adjuvaturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Sat. 18</bibl></cit>: adjŭro or adjuero = adjuvero, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuerit = adjuverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">to give aid to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>: aliquem. (Adjuvare applies to every kind of help or support; while <hi rend="ital">auxiliari</hi> is only used of one who, from his weakness, needs assistance, and <hi rend="ital">subvenire</hi> of one who is in difficulty or embarrassment; cf. Manut. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7</bibl>.) </sense><sense id="n862.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: O Tite, si quid te adjuero curamve levāsso quae nunc te coquit, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 339 Vahl.): di me etsi perdunt, tamen esse adjutam expetunt, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 14</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Rel. p. 102</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">miseras, inopes, aerumnosas aliquo auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operā me adjuves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me adjuves in hac re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id spero adjuturos deos (i. e. in ea re),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad verum probandum auctoritas adjuvat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil ad percipiendam colendamque virtutem litteris adjuvarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: maerorem orationis lacrimis suis, id. de Or. <pb n="39" /> <cb n="ADMI" /> 2, 47: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Hortensii operā rem publicam adjutam (esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: si nos mediocris fortuna rei publicae adjuverit, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in filiarum collocatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliis et copiis, i. e. militibus auxiliariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua sponte eos adjutum profectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antiochum Aetolosque adjuturos pronuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortĭs fortuna adjuvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 25</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 15</bibl> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutus casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vitell. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuvare preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennis adjutus amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 540</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:504" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 504</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:249" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 249</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:326" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 326</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n862.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n862.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cherish</hi> (esp. a state of mind), <hi rend="ital">to sustain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tu quoque hujus adjuvas insaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferendus error immo vero etiam adjuvandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore Romani adjuvant militem suum,</quote> <trans><tr>animate</tr>, <tr>encourage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formam cură,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 732</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n862.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (very rare), <hi rend="ital">to profit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be of use</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be profitable</hi> (syn.: utile est, operae pretium est, convenit). </sense><sense id="n862.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re mala animo si bono utare, adjuvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n862.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo aliquid adjuvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alteri non multum adjuvabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuvat hoc quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 73</bibl></cit>.!*? Rare constructions. </sense><sense id="n862.7" n="a" level="4"> With a whole <hi rend="ital">subjective clause</hi> with <hi rend="ital">quod</hi> as subject: multum eorum opinionem adjuvat, quod (<hi rend="ital">the circumstance that</hi>) sine jumentis ... ad iter profectos videbant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n862.8" n="b" level="4"> With two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrides in re tanta? neque me quidquam consilio adjuvas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. Rudd. II. p. 179, <gen>n.</gen> 75.— </sense><sense id="n862.9" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut amplissimum nomen consequeremur, unus praeter ceteros adjuvisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjuvato, nequis liminis obseret tabellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 324</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n862.10" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: adjuvat enim (pater, <hi rend="ital">the male</hi>) incubare, <hi rend="ital">helps to hatch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 29, § 85</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n862.11" n="e" level="4"> With the <case>dat.</case> of the person and the <case>acc.</case> of the thing: <cit><quote lang="la">operam mutuam dent et messem hanc nobis adjuvent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. adjuto.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">adjŭvans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non haec adjuvantia causarum, sed has ipsas esse omnium causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adl: <entryFree id="n863" type="main" key="adl"><orth extent="full" lang="la">adl</orth>. Words beginning thus, v. under all.</entryFree>
admaturo: <entryFree id="n864" type="hapax" key="adma_tu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-mātūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring to maturity;</hi> fig., <hi rend="ital">to mature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">admaturari defectionem civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 54, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
admensus: <entryFree id="n865" type="main" key="admensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of admetior.</entryFree>
admeo: <entryFree id="n866" type="hapax" key="adme^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-mĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">approach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">admeabunt monstra natatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 17, 119</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
admetior: <entryFree id="n867" type="main" key="adme_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-mētĭor</orth>, <itype>mensus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, <sense id="n867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to measure out to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum emptoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (sc. vinum) admensum erit,</quote> <trans><tr>measured out</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 148</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
admetus: <entryFree id="n868" type="main" key="Adme_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Admētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n868.0" n="I" level="1"> In mythology, <hi rend="ital">a king of Pherœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Alcestis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose sheep Apollo was condemned by Jupiter to tend for a long time</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 761</bibl> (cf. Alcestis).—</sense><sense id="n868.1" n="II" level="1"> In hist., <hi rend="ital">a king of the Molossi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the friend and protector of Themistocles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
admigro: <entryFree id="n869" type="hapax" key="admi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-mī^gro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, lit., <sense id="n869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go to</hi> a place; hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">to come to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be added to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad paupertatem si admigrant infamiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adminiculabundus: <entryFree id="n870" type="main" key="admi^ni^cu^la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnĭcŭlābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>adminiculo</etym>, <sense id="n870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supporting one's self</hi>, Auct. Itin. Alex. 21 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
adminiculator: <entryFree id="n871" type="hapax" key="admi^ni^cu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnĭcŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who supports</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a supporter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tirone Cicero adminiculatore et quasi administro in studiis litterarum usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
adminiculo: <entryFree id="n872" type="main" key="admi^ni^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>adminiculum</etym> (orig. belonging to agriculture and botany), <sense id="n872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to support.</hi> </sense><sense id="n872.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites adminiculatae sudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>; so Col.: vitem adminiculato arborique jungito, de Arb. 16 (Cic. has for this adminiculor, q. v.).—</sense><sense id="n872.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, = adjuvo (only ante- and post-class.): adminiculavi voluntatem tuam scribendo, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 77, 16</bibl>: tribunicio auxilio adminiculati, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.: id ipsum, quod dicimus,<cb n="ADMI" />  ex illis quoque Homericis versibus adminiculari potest, i. e. confirmari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:30" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 30</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Di vitam hominum adminiculantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 44</bibl> Müll., calls adverbs partes adminiculandi (orationem), <hi rend="ital">auxiliaries of discourse.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnĭcŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">supported;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">well furnished</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provided</hi>: memoria adminiculatior, Gell. praef. 1. 1.</sense></entryFree>
adminiculor: <entryFree id="n873" type="hapax" key="admi^ni^cu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnĭcŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. adminiculo, <sense id="n873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi> (a vine): ars agricolarum, quae circumcidat, amputet, erigat, extollat, adminiculetur, etc., * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 14, 39</bibl>; v. Madv. ad h. l. (Priscian considers this <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> as the usual form, and hence gives the example cited from Varro under adminiculo as an exception, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 791</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 927</bibl> ib.).</sense></entryFree>
adminiculum: <entryFree id="n874" type="main" key="admi^ni^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ad-manus</etym>, prop., <sense id="n874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that on which the hand</hi> may rest, then in gen., <hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support.</hi> </sense><sense id="n874.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n874.2" n="A" level="2"> Orig. in the language of vine-dressers, <hi rend="ital">the stake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pole to which the vine clings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and by which it is supported</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites claviculis adminicula, tamquam manibus apprehendunt, atque ita se erigunt, ut animantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adminiculorum ordines, capitum jugatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:chapter=15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 36, § 215</bibl>; cf. Drak. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1, 4</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n874.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., of any <hi rend="ital">prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>: adminicula hominum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">oxen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implements of agriculture</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">motam (Junonem) sede sua parvi molimenti adminiculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adminicula gubernandi addidit Tiphys,</quote> <trans><tr>means of steering</tr>, <tr>the rudder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 209</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 162</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n874.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">auxiliary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad legionem cum itant, adminiculum eis danunt aliquem cognatum,</quote> <trans><tr>an assistant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc igitur partem relictam explebimus, nullis adminiculis, sed, ut dicitur, Marte nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura solitarium nihil amat, semperque ad aliquod tamquam adminiculum adnititur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo primo adminiculo erecta erat (urbs), eodem innisa M. Furio principe stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id senectuti suae adminiculum fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egere adminiculis, ut in commune consulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in militia aut via fessus adminiculum oro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius externi indigens adminiculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quibus debetis esse adminiculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,019:16:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Esth. 16, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
administer: <entryFree id="n875" type="main" key="admi^nister"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-mĭnister</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who is near to aid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant;</hi> lit. and trop. (class.)—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovi se consiliarium atque administrum datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 19, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum neque bellum gerere sine administris posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 74</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer victūs cotidiani administer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administri et satellites Sexti Naevii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 25, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satelles atque administer audaciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administer ipsius cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum transactor et administer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socius et administer omnium consiliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 29, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">administris ad ea sacrificia Druidibus utuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
administra: <entryFree id="n876" type="main" key="admi^nistra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnistra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>administer</etym>, <sense id="n876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">helper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a handmaid.</hi>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg> and fig.: “<hi rend="ital">Camillam</hi> qui glossemata interpretati dixerunt administram,” <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 34</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">multae sunt artes eximiae hujus administrae comitesque virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 13, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
administratio: <entryFree id="n877" type="main" key="admi^nistra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnistrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>administro</etym>. <sense id="n877.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a ministration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nec haberemus, nisi manus et ars accessissent, nec his sine hominum administratione uteremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>the right distribution of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n877.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">the direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">management</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">administration of</hi> a thing, i. q. curatio, procuratio: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum (di) omni curatione et administratione rerum vacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum magnarum agitatio atque administratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:163" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portūs,</quote> <trans><tr>the use of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ideo habentes administrationem,</quote> <trans><tr>ministry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
administratiuncula: <entryFree id="n878" type="hapax" key="admi^nistra_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnistrātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>administratio</etym>, <sense id="n878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little administration</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 4, 10. <cb n="ADMI" /></sense></entryFree>
administrativus: <entryFree id="n879" type="hapax" key="admi^nistra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnistrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>administro</etym>, <sense id="n879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suitable for the administration of a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(rhetorice ars) activa vel administrativa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
administrator: <entryFree id="n880" type="main" key="admi^nistra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnistrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, lit., <sense id="n880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that is near to aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">in the care of a thing;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a manager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conductor</hi> (cf. administro): <cit><quote lang="la">(imperator est) administrator quidam belli gerendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:48:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 48, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:10 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 4, 10 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
administratorius: <entryFree id="n881" type="main" key="admi^nistra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admĭnistrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>administrator</etym>, <sense id="n881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">performing the duties of an assistant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">helper; serving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ministering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angeli, qui sunt administratorii spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Jes. 46, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Hebr. 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
administro: <entryFree id="n882" type="main" key="admi^nistro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ad-mĭnistro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n882.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be near as an aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attend upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve</hi> (ministrum esse ad aliquam rem): <cit><quote lang="la">conductam esse eam, quae hic administraret ad rem divinam tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia per sacerdotes administrabuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">David in sua generatione cum administrasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Act. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel ad principia convivii et in secundam mensam administratur,</quote> <trans><tr>is served up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, with esp. ref. to the object, </sense><sense id="n882.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">to take charge of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">administer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">execute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accomplish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, etc. (the most usual signif. of this word; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq. in Cic. and the histt.): a nobis omnia populi R. semper et belli adjumenta et pacis ornamenta administrata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 47</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <trans><tr>to govern</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges et judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 11</bibl>; cf. Drak. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 36</bibl> (a military t. t.); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 58</bibl></cit>; Herz. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl>, and Cortius ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem familiarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ab uno omnia imperia administrari poterant,</quote> <trans><tr>be issued</tr>, <tr>given</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <trans><tr>to guide</tr>, <tr>steer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionarii, qui dextram partem operis administrabant,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who conducted the siege on the right side</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustriores legationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida et fines alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 22</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vitell. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (the <case>acc.</case> must be supplied from that which precedes): <cit><quote lang="la">neque administrandi (sc. navigium) neque repellendi facultas dabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Al. 21" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Al. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites neque pro opere consistere neque inter vineas sine periculo administrare poterant,</quote> <trans><tr>nor ... pursue their work without peril</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 92, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si celeriter administraverint (sc. hoc opus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5, p. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5, p. 19</bibl></cit> Rod. (others translate administrare in this place, <hi rend="ital">to put the hand to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to render service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do one's duty</hi>, etc.).—Unus.: virtutem, innocentiam, diligentiam alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to employ</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
admirabilis: <entryFree id="n883" type="main" key="admi_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">admīrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>admiror</etym>. <sense id="n883.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Worthy of admiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">admirable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wonderful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirabilis in dicendo vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">O clementiam admirabilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitatem atque constantiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 10</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Ironically: o admirabilem impudentiam, audaciam, temeritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">o admirabilior oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo pop. R. admirabilior adversis rebus quam secundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirabilem licentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam admirabile est nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tenebris vos vocavit in admirabile lumen suum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 9.—</sense><sense id="n883.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That produces wonder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wonderful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astonishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paradoxical</hi>: haec <foreign lang="greek">para/doca</foreign> ili, nos admirabilia dicamus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 27</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">id. Par. praef. and Par. 4: admirabile genus (causae), a quo alienatus est animus eorum qui audituri sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:15:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 15, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse admirabilius Romanos Graeciā pelli quam Hannibalem Italiā pulsum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 50</bibl></cit>; also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:47" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 47</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> not used.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">admīrābĭlĭter</orth> (only in the <hi rend="ital">posit.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n883.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Admirably</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 53, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 6:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 6, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 14, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n883.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Paradoxically</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strangely</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">parado/cws</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
